title:
Junior Business Intelligence Analyst or BI As
- job post
description:
!!CREATE YOUR LEGACY WITH THE LEGACY COMPANIES!!
Position Overview:
Supports the BI team in creating and maintaining standard operational reports using Power BI and Excel. Focus on handling routine reporting tasks and dataset preparation.
Job Responsibilities:
Create and update recurring reports using Power BI and Excel based on existing templates and specifications.
Assist in data extraction and basic SQL queries from the data lake.
Perform data validation and ensure accuracy of reporting outputs.
Document reporting processes and maintain internal documentation.
Support the BI Analyst in identifying opportunities to improve or automate reporting workflows.
Help prepare and clean datasets for analysis when needed.
Requirements:
Basic to intermediate skills in Power BI and Excel.
Foundational SQL knowledge (ability to read and modify simple queries).
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Ability to follow technical instructions and clearly document steps.
Nice to have: Experience with ERP systems or prior work in a BI or data-focused environment.
Nice to have: Experience with Power Automate.

title:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
- job post
description:
Location: Baltimore, MD (On-site in the office 3 days per week)
Company Overview
Arena Analytics is a fast-growing startup in Baltimore’s Harbor Point, with a mission to use AI and predictive analytics to empower both job seekers and employers. We provide actionable insights into workforce dynamics, helping organizations identify ideal candidates and enabling job seekers to uncover opportunities that best fit their backgrounds and goals.
Position Summary
We are seeking a BI Analyst with strong Tableau and SQL skills (Python is a plus) to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will transform raw data into meaningful visualizations and dashboards that showcase Arena’s workforce insights and measure our impact on key KPIs. You will work closely with our Data Science and Product teams to develop and deliver polished analytics products for our clients.

You will be expected to work in the office 3-5 days per week in our Baltimore office at 1300 Thames Street to collaborate effectively with other team members.
Key Responsibilities
Develop, maintain, and enhance client-facing dashboards primarily in Tableau
Translate complex datasets into compelling visual stories to drive data-informed decisions
Collaborate with Data Science and Product teams to identify requirements, design data models, and ensure seamless data integrations
Provide insights into workforce trends, applicant pools, and performance metrics relevant to our client base
Present findings and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders
Required Qualifications
Proven hands-on experience with Tableau (dashboard creation, data visualization best practices)
Strong proficiency in SQL (querying, data manipulation, performance optimization)
Familiarity with data visualization principles and an eye for design/detail
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Preferred Qualifications
Experience using Python for data analysis or automation
Background in AI, predictive analytics, or related domains
Prior startup or fast-paced environment experience
Additional Details
Work Environment: This is an on-site role in our waterfront office at Harbor Point, Baltimore. You will have the opportunity for close collaboration with cross-functional teams, fostering rapid learning and innovation.
Benefits & Culture: We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and the chance to be part of a growing company that values diversity, creativity, and passion for data-driven solutions.
If you’re excited to leverage your BI and data visualization expertise to help shape the future of workforce analytics, apply now and join Arena Analytics in our mission to connect talent with opportunity and insights.

title:
Data Analyst – Business Intelligence & Reporting Specialist (Power BI & Tableau)
- job post
description:
Opportunity:
Olmstead drives business success by helping clients build and leverage a strong data foundation. The right data strategy can reduce risk, increase productivity, improve decision making, and fuel innovation. We are seeking a hands-on detail-oriented data analyst with investment management industry experience and expertise with business intelligence and reporting.
Candidates will have mastery in business intelligence and experience with SQL, data modeling, and data governance. They are not afraid to roll up their sleeves, challenge the status quo, leverage best practices, and grow beyond their comfort zone. They are an excellent communicator that uses precise language and frames messaging in business terms.
As a valued member of our expert data management consulting team, you will engage clients to document and analyze their data landscape. The Analyst will help the client grow, develop new capabilities, and optimize data management. You will deliver solutions across a wide range of data-oriented engagements, such as investment management reporting, data governance, data migrations, and data warehousing.
Responsibilities:
Aid current state assessments by collecting information on data sources, data flows, information consumption, and information production
Produce reports and data mashups to answer business related questions
Trace data requirements, data sources, and data flows for processes and reports
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity
Produce project deliverables that itemize and summarize to aid comprehension and decision making
Collaborate with client stakeholders and team members to understand analytic needs and deliver actionable insights
Maintain a point of view on leading data management solutions available from the market, such as business intelligence, data governance, data catalog, and data quality solutions
Qualifications:
Possess strong business knowledge of the investment management industry and common data management operations
Mastery creating Business Intelligence reports using Power BI and Tableau
Proficient in design and implementation of both online dashboards and printed page reports
Expertise organizing and managing reporting services (Power BI Service, Tableau Online)
Skilled with version control and life cycle management of report artifacts
Data modeling expertise for investment data domains, such as security master, accounts, holdings, transactions, etc.
Strong hands-on SQL and Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Familiarity with data management conventions and best practices
If you are interested in joining Olmstead, please send an email to recruiting@olmst.com

title:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
- job post
description:
At Authentic8, we empower organizations to redefine how digital investigations are conducted in an increasingly complex online world. With Silo for Research, our industry-leading solution, we enable secure and anonymous investigations across the surface, deep, and dark web—helping national security, defense, law enforcement, and enterprises uncover critical insights while staying protected.

Designed from the ground up with zero-trust principles and built on globally scaled infrastructure, Silo for Research addresses today's toughest cybersecurity challenges, allowing investigators to work smarter, faster, and safer. Trusted by more than 700 customers worldwide, our platform transforms how intelligence work is done.

Join us, and be part of a mission to protect and empower those who safeguard our world. From our collaborative teams to our cutting-edge technology, we’re not just building solutions—we’re shaping the future of digital investigations.

Authentic8 is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you will report to the Director of Financial Operations and play a critical part in helping the company leverage data for strategic decision-making. You will be responsible for delivering high-impact insights across the business by analyzing key performance indicators, developing visualizations, and enabling data-informed decisions.

This is a cross-functional role requiring strong collaboration with stakeholders across Finance, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Product, and Operations. The ideal candidate brings both technical expertise and business acumen, with the ability to work tactically with data while thinking strategically about how insights drive business performance. The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will be responsible for transforming data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the company. This role requires expertise in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools to enhance business processes and performance.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop, maintain, and enhance dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools such as Tableau and Looker.
Analyze business trends, key performance indicators (KPIs), and operational metrics to provide insights and recommendations.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets from multiple sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, marketing, sales, and operations, to support their data needs.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation through data analysis.
Assist in defining and tracking business goals by developing data-driven models and forecasts.
Support ad hoc reporting and deep-dive analyses to answer key business questions.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4 years of experience in a BI or data analysis role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating data.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Tableau and Looker) and data visualization best practices.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into meaningful insights.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Must be a US Citizen

Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google BigQuery)
Background in financial analysis, marketing analytics, or operational analytics.
Understanding predictive analytics.
Experience leveraging AI tools and prompt engineering to enhance workflows and improve efficiency.
Salary
$105,000 - $120,000 + Bonus & Equity
Individual pay will be determined by location and additional factors, including job related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.
Authentic8 Core Values & Principles:

Integrity: We apply our best efforts. We are honest with and accountable to others.
Mission-Focused: We clearly define and communicate our goals and do not stray in the pursuit of our objective.
Respect: We value and respect the ideas and experience our diverse backgrounds bring us. Positive consideration of differing viewpoints makes us stronger.
We are collaborative: We recognize the best work is the product of teams. We must each be reliable and expect to rely on others.
We are transparent: By operating with common information and understanding we ensure that we are aligned.
We find innovative solutions: We seek innovative solutions not as a buzzword but as a means to solve difficult problems with zeal, efficiency and quality.
We take ownership: We are responsible for our actions, our reputation and our business.

Authentic8 offers competitive benefits, including medical, dental and vision, flexible PTO, a 401k program and stock options.

It is the policy of Authentic8 to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title:
Sr. Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst
- job post
description:
Overview:
The Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst is responsible for developing, publishing, and maintaining a comprehensive catalog of key performance indicators (KPIs) and reports across functional areas of the mortgage business. This includes building and validating metrics, integrating datasets, monitoring data quality, analyzing data, and interpreting results to provide actionable insights that drive business value. The role offers high visibility and cross-functional collaboration across all departments within the Consumer Direct (CD) and Third-Party Originations (TPO) channels. The ideal candidate brings a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and deep expertise in mortgage banking.

This 100% remote role offers a competitive salary range of $100,000 to $115,000, an annual bonus, medical benefits starting on day one, and a company-matched 401(k).
Responsibilities:
Gather and analyze data from multiple systems to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement within the sales and marketing departments.
Drive data-informed decision-making by designing dashboards, building out key performance indicators (KPIs), and developing self-service tools to empower internal teams.
Collaborate with business units across CD and TPO channels to define reporting needs, optimize data usage, and provide actionable recommendations that enhance business strategies.
Partner with leadership to develop reports that track risk, operational performance, compliance, and customer satisfaction, supporting overall business success.
Extracting, transforming, and loading data from various sources to create cohesive datasets in Power BI.
Design dashboards and write code to translate reporting requirements into technical solutions using SQL and Power BI.
Oversee and manage tickets within Lakeview’s Originations and Correspondents reporting pipeline, ensuring timely and accurate completion.
Research and analyze key business requirements needed for report requests to translate into analytical solutions.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and address specific inquiries from stakeholders.
Ensure data integrity and report accuracy by conducting regular quality checks, troubleshooting discrepancies, and validating data across systems.
Act as the subject matter expert on mortgage reporting tools, methodologies, and industry best practices
Provide guidance and education to other Business Intelligence Analysts as necessary.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Finance, Business Administration, Mathematics, Business Intelligence, or related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in business intelligence, analytics, or a related field. Preferably with a focus on the mortgage banking industry
Encompass and servicing platform experience preferred.
Strong knowledge of SQL, DAX, and PowerQuery.
Proficient in using MS Excel, PowerBI, Snowflake, and SSMS.
Strong analytical skills.
Experience working with large datasets and data warehousing concepts.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to interact and communicate with stakeholders, particularly executives or senior leaders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Lakeview is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All aspects of consideration for employment and employment with the Company are governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

title:

- job post
description:
Overview

Fusion Medical Staffing is searching for a BI Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics & Reporting team. In this position, you will review data to produce sales metrics performance, finance, and market intelligence reports. Fusion uses those reports to highlight patterns and trends in the staffing industry to help influence Fusion’s operations and quarter/yearly goals.

Essential Functions
Understanding of the ETL process, data warehousing and associated activities to implement the best programs to use in managing the data
Mine data, analyze data, and assist in the build out of internal analytical tools to improve decision making and support for the analytics team and reporting to cross functional teams.
Assist in the Design, development, and automation of metrics-based internal reporting, including visuals and Ad-Hoc reporting packages
Gather requirements and define scope for reporting needs, meeting to ensure specific data needed on a project basis.
Ability to manage multiple data sources and systems with logic to ensure proper data file creation.
Ensure a high level of communication and liaison duties with IT/Technology and Operational departments.

Excellent communication and people skills

Team Player

Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment, such as a phone, headset, calculator, copier, and printer

Experience in building visualizations and dashboards in Tableau, PowerBI, or other related Business Intelligence tools

title:
FamilySearch Business Intelligence Data Analyst
- job post
description:
The Family History Department (FamilySearch International) seeks to enable inspiring journeys that bring joy to all people as they discover, gather, and connect their family – past, present, and future.
The Business Intelligence (BI) Team assists FHD management in setting strategy and measuring business objectives that maximize efficient use of resources. To accomplish this, we build, maintain, and utilize a single-source-of-truth Enterprise Data Warehouse and other tools to provide data, analysis, and reports that are independent, timely, accurate, and meaningful.
The Data Analyst position is a full-time benefited position based in Lehi, Utah. Candidates seeking to work remotely will not be considered.

Develop reports, analysis, and dashboards using SQL and Tableau and Power BI to meet the needs of key partners and stakeholders.
Meet with partners and stakeholders to receive requests and input, determine analytical needs within the department, and define standardized data sets to meet those needs.
Be able to confidently and persuasively present analyses to fellow BI team members, key stakeholders within the organization, and senior decision makers.
Become proficient with all available data sources, data structure, and metrics currently in use in the Family History Department.
Assist with increasing the data literacy and adoption of created dashboards and analyses among data consumers within the Family History Department.
Become a subject matter expert in visualization and dashboard development utilizing Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, and other data analysis and presentation tools.
Assess and test analytical tools and methodologies for potential use on the BI Team.

Completed degree in one of the following areas: Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, Data Science, Information Systems, Statistics, or another analytical field.
Work experience of 3+ years in a business intelligence or related role or a master’s degree and 1+ years in a business intelligence or related role.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, etc.).
Strong SQL skills are required, experience with Python coding and Databricks is a plus.
Ability to research and understand a customer's needs, problems, and potential constraints.
Understanding the analytical process and having a curious and inquisitive mindset.
Ability to work with minimal supervision and identify opportunities to provide value.
Ability to troubleshoot, research, and learn using generative artificial intelligence.
Ability to build and maintain relationships.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Familiarity and experience with the FamilySearch website and apps are a plus.

Church employees find joy and satisfaction in using their unique talents and abilities to further the Lord’s work. From the IT professional who develops an app that sends the gospel message worldwide, to the facilities manager who maintains our buildings— giving Church members places to worship, teach, learn, and receive sacred ordinances—our employees seek innovative ways to share the gospel of Jesus Christ with the world. They are literally working in His kingdom.
Only members of the Church who are worthy of a temple recommend qualify for employment. Apart from this, the Church is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on any basis that would violate U.S. or local law.
Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, color, gender, pregnancy, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or other legally protected categories that apply to the Church. The Church will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities.

title:
Data Analyst/Power BI Developer
- job post
description:
Piper Enterprise Solutions is currently seeking a skilled secret level Data Analyst/Power BI Developer to support a defense driven team in a hybrid capacity based in Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD.

Responsibilities of the Data Analyst/Power BI Developer include:
Lead initiatives to modernize SAMD’s technical infrastructure by improving existing systems and processes for enhanced efficiency and effectiveness
Design, develop, and implement solutions using Microsoft Power Apps and Power BI to support projects such as performance metrics and Foreign Military Sales (FMS) case development and execution.
Create custom applications and workflows using Power Apps and Power Automate to streamline internal processes such as dashboard requirement collection and routine data tasks.
Represent SAMD in working group meetings and collaborate with external points of contact (POCs) who are developing related systems or tools.
Prepare for and oversee the integration of a closed network AI system into SAMD’s operations once available.
Leverage Microsoft Copilot 365 to streamline documentation, reporting, and productivity workflows, integrating AI capabilities into business processes

Qualifications of the Data Analyst/Power BI Developer include:
5-8+ years of relevant experience with Power Platform, and specialized skills in AI and Microsoft 365 Copilot integration
Strong experience with Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power BI, Power Automate).
Proven track record of digital transformation or process improvement initiatives.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills.
Experience in knowledge management and dashboard development.
Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Bachelor's degree in relevant field
Secret clearance required

Compensation of the Data Analyst/Power BI Developer includes:
Salary Range: $100,000 - $150,000
Comprehensive Benefits package: Hybrid environment, Healthcare, Dental, Vision, 401k, Paid Time Off, paid holidays and Sick Leave (as required by law)

This job opens for applications on 7/11/25. Applications for this job will be accepted for at least 30 days from the posting date.

Keywords:
Data Analysis, data analytics, business intelligence, Power BI, DAX, Power Query, Data Modeling, Data Visualization, SQL, Excel, ETL, Data Transformation, Business Intelligence, Dashboards, KPIs, Data Warehousing, Microsoft Azure, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Python, R, Data Cleaning, Data Integration, Report Automation, Data Governance, Data Quality, Tableau, SSIS, SSRS, Microsoft SQL Server, Relational Databases, Big Data, Analytics, Insights, Forecasting, Trend Analysis, Data Mining, Performance Metrics, Interactive Reports, Row-Level Security, Measures, Calculated Columns, Data Sources, API Integration, Agile, Scrum, Stakeholder Communication, Storytelling with Data, foreign military sales, FMS, copilot, Microsoft copilot, documentation, reporting, benefits, medical, dental, vision, 401k

- job post
description:
All Job Postings will close at 12:01a.m. CST (1:01a.m. EST) on the specified Closing Date (if designated).
If you close the browser or exit your application prior to submitting, the application progress will be saved as a draft. You will be able to access and complete the application through “My Draft Applications” located on your Candidate Home page.
Job Posting Title:
BI Developer and Data Analyst 1

Position Type:
Professional / Unclassified

Department:
LSUAM FA - ITS - DA - PS - Business Intelligence (Anthony Joseph Alfonso (00012319))

Work Location:
0202 Fred C. Frey Computing Services Building

Pay Grade:
Professional

Job Description:
Data warehouse design and configuration for mission-critical enterprise data warehouse and reporting needs. Provides support for data warehouses. Responsible for coding and documenting procedures and for programming, testing, and debugging data warehouses. Familiar with concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on experience and judgement to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is expected. All Information Technology Services employees are expected to demonstrate a commitment to exemplary customer service in all facets of their work.
Job Responsibilities:
Data Analysis, Query, Report Writing: Work with IT personnel, central administrative staff, and end users to conduct data analysis and validation, perform ad-hoc queries, and to design, develop, and maintain reports and related reporting programming artifacts. Follow programming design principles and best practices. Comply with software quality assurance standards, business goals, and project timelines in an agile delivery environment. Through release/upgrade notifications validate report functionality and edit reports as needed. (60%)
Data Design: Work with IT data modelers, central administrative staff, and end users to design data models, data sets, and data definitions for enterprise business intelligence (EBI) reporting and for use with data visualization technology solutions.
Test report and validate that it meets clients requirements. Prepare reports for deployment to multiple environments using established control protocols. Document and share technical and functional changes with colleagues. Coordinate and communicate system-related events with ITS support and communications personnel with a goal of providing excellent customer service. (20%)
Reporting Platform Administration / System Technical Support: Manage daily tickets and cyclical (release/upgrades) administration of reporting and analytics solutions in collaboration with other IT personnel, campus partners, and the campus community at large. Ensure the overall health of the technology platform. Apply software maintenance. Reduce operational complexity. Deign and implement system security. Perform capacity planning and management. Serve as escalation point for production and/or platform issues. (10%)
Other duties as assigned. (10%)
Candidates will be expected to work on campus. This position does not offer a remote work option.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree.
1 year of professional work experience.
LSU is dedicated to fostering an environment where our employees feel appreciated for their skills and individuality. If a candidate does not meet the minimum qualifications as listed but has substantial experience in the key job responsibilities, we encourage them to apply.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree.
A degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Science, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
Programming for various data driven tasks like analysis, extraction, cleaning, validation, summarization, manipulating, creating datasets and generating reports
Awareness of dimensional modelling, Star Schemas, Data Marts.
Proficient with Microsoft Office products

original transcripts are required prior to hire.

title:
Data Analyst/Data Visualization Developer (PSS2), Rowan Online
- job post
description:
Data Analyst/Data Visualization Developer
Help Rowan University make data-driven decisions that shape the future of online education.
Rowan University's next area of explosive growth is Rowan Online, and you can be the professional who helps our leadership team understand the data related to our students, faculty, and courses. We're looking for a Data Analyst who gets excited about transforming numbers into actionable insights.
What you'll do
You'll evaluate datasets from across our university to answer the big questions: Are online students succeeding? Which courses are working best? How can we support our online faculty more effectively? Then, you'll compile, analyze, and present dashboards that directly influence how we operate and grow.
Your work will include:
Analyzing student information, including performance, engagement, and retention patterns
Tracking course effectiveness and identifying improvement opportunities
Evaluating performance and faculty support needs
Creating clear, compelling reports and dashboards for leadership
Building data models that help predict trends and outcomes
Collaborating with different departments to understand their data needs
Why this role matters
Good decisions require great data, and that's exactly what you'll provide. Our leadership team relies on accurate and timely insights to make informed choices that impact thousands of students and hundreds of faculty members. Your analysis will help Rowan Online to understand where to invest resources, which programs to expand, and how to better serve and enrich our online academic community.
What we're looking for
3+ years of experience analyzing data with tools like Tableau.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, and at least one statistical software (R, Python, or similar)
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
Ability to explain complex findings to non-technical audiences
Detail-oriented but also able to see the big picture
Curious mindset and knack for asking the right questions
What you'll get
Flexible/Hybrid work arrangements with State Holidays and 3+ weeks of paid time off
Professional development opportunities
Chance to directly impact how we serve our students
Collaborative team that values your expertise
Salary & Benefits:
In compliance with The State of New Jersey's Pay Transparency Act, the annual base salary range for this position is AFT: Range 24 $73,899.91 to $84,980.25, with placement within the range determined by candidate's qualifications, professional experience, internal equity, and other factors.
For eligible employees, benefits include: comprehensive NJ State health, dental and retirement benefits, extensive accrued time off/paid holidays, and tuition reimbursement for employee, spouse, and dependents to attend Rowan University, Glassboro. (Tuition reimbursement will apply to undergraduate degrees only for spouse and dependents).”
For more detailed information, please visit: https://sites.rowan.edu/hr/benefits/
Notes:
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the US, and the university will not sponsor an applicant for a work visa for this position.
Only completed, online applications submitted on or before the deadline will be considered.
Ready to help us make smarter decisions with better data? We'd love to hear from you.

title:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DATA ANALYST
- job post
description:
Overview:
Lakeview Digital builds the consumer-facing mortgage platform for the nation’s largest mortgage servicing rights investor, dedicated to enriching the lives of homeowners through personalized digital experiences and streamlined financial products. We’re building the simplest and most powerful way for prospective and current homeowners to manage their home and access tailored lending solutions.
As part of our foundational analytics team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping how we use data to drive decisions across product, marketing, operations, and customer experience. Reporting into the Senior Leader for BI and Analytics, you will help turn raw data into actionable insights that guide strategy and fuel innovation.
ABOUT THE ROLE:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst at Lakeview Digital, you'll bridge data and business strategy—deciphering customer needs, solving ambiguous problems, and crafting solutions that elevate the homeownership experience. You'll work cross-functionally to build scalable, trustworthy data products that help business and product leaders make informed, data-driven decisions.
We’re looking for someone with strong analytical and problem-solving skills, a detail-oriented mindset, and the ability to translate complex data into clear narratives. You will partner closely with product managers, software engineers, marketing, and operations, helping shape how data is collected, modeled, and analyzed across the organization.
Responsibilities:
Own the design, development, and maintenance of scalable reporting solutions, calculated metrics, and data pipelines.
Deliver high-quality analyses to support business decisions across product, marketing, and operations.
Validate and ensure data accuracy across tools, pipelines, and reports.
Translate complex data into simple, compelling insights for diverse stakeholders, from frontline operators to senior leadership.
Build automation and self-serve tools to minimize manual reporting and increase speed to insight.
Partner with product teams to define metrics and support statistically valid A/B testing practices.
Support marketing analytics efforts across paid channels, CRM, and customer journey optimization.
Participate in the executive team’s business review process by delivering key insights and business performance narratives.
Help shape data foundations, including data modeling and instrumentation best practices.
Champion a customer-centric mindset in all analytics work to enhance the homeowner experience.
WHAT A DAY MIGHT LOOK LIKE:
Collaborating with Product and Engineering to implement new event tracking.
Running root cause analysis to explain a shift in conversion rates or operational metrics.
Presenting business impact insights to leadership with recommendations for optimization.
Building a new set of metrics to visualize trends in customer engagement.
Writing SQL to pull custom data for a marketing campaign analysis.
Qualifications:
Basic:
3+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or analytics engineering.
Proficiency in SQL (Snowflake, Redshift, or similar).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Scripting ability in Python, Java, or R for data analysis.
Preferred:
Bachelor's degree or advanced degree in a STEM field.
Experience with statistical analysis and experimentation (A/B testing).
Familiarity with data modeling and modern data pipeline design.
Experience working in a fintech, mortgage, or consumer tech startup environment.
YOU MIGHT BE A GREAT FIT IF YOU:
Thrive in ambiguity and are energized by solving open-ended problems.
Enjoy building clean, scalable solutions from scratch.
Think like a business partner, not just a data specialist.
Are passionate about customer experience and impact-driven analytics.
Can balance strategic thinking with hands-on execution.
Have an eye for process improvement and automation opportunities.
Want to be part of a small, fast-moving team building something meaningful from the ground up.
WHY JOIN LAKEVIEW DIGITAL?
You’ll be joining a nimble, mission-driven team at the earliest stages of growth, with significant influence on how we use data to build the future of homeownership. You’ll work directly with experienced leaders and have room to grow your career as our team scales.
Lakeview Digital is proud to be a remote-first organization with a collaborative culture that values innovation, transparency, and ownership. We are committed to equal opportunity and an inclusive, supportive work environment.

Location: Remote-first (with optional offices in New York, NY or Coral Gables, FL)
Salary range: $120,000 to $150,000 plus bonus, based on experience and qualifications
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to handle, touch or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk and hear. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms. The employee is rarely required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
EEOC
Lakeview Digital / Bayview Asset Management / Lakeview Loan Servicing is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All aspects of consideration for employment and employment with the Company are governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

title:
Business Intelligence Data Analyst
- job post
description:
29 May, 2025
Strategy
Orlando, United States of America
Full time
Hybrid
In this role you will:
We are seeking a skilled, pragmatic, detail-oriented Data Analyst to transform data into strategic insights that drive business decisions, innovation, and performance enhancements for WebBeds’ Americas business. This role will be responsible for collecting, maintaining and analysing data that can be translated into insights to guide our business strategy as well as inform product development efforts.
The BI Data Analyst will manage and analyse complex datasets, ensuring data integrity, uncovering trends, and providing data-driven recommendations to support business objectives. You’ll collaborate across data and commercial teams to meet data needs efficiently while setting a new standard for data insights.
Key Responsibilities.
Design, build and implement market leading PowerBI dashboards that not only report on past trends but also visualise predictive insights, uncover hidden patterns, and provide actionable
Deeply understand business objectives by engaging users and stakeholders to design analytics solutions that meet strategic goals; communicate with stakeholders proactively throughout the project to gather input, keep them updated on deadlines, and coordinate with other teams
Act as a trusted advisor when questions arise regarding BI solutions, insights and metrics, working with management to prioritize business and information needs
Address unstructured, complex business problems through advanced analytics and share strategic suggestions to improve data decisions for the business
Work on data modelling, metric development, prototyping of predictive models and analytics solutions to identify growth and revenue optimisation opportunities
Analyse and synthesise large datasets using advanced data science techniques to create cohesive, practical insights that can drive the company’s strategic initiatives
Act as a subject matter expert on machine learning techniques, including large language models (LLM
Identify, evaluate, and implement process improvements to enhance data capabilities and contribute to an evolving data culture
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data analytics, data visualisation and data science
The skills we would love to see in your suitcase.
3+ years’ experience in data analytics and business intelligence, with a strong background in machine learning (supervised and unsupervised learning, LLMs) and predictive analytics to drive projects from concept to production
Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or similar relevant field
Advanced knowledge of and experience with PowerBI and BI solutions development, including MS PowerApps and Power Automate
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and modelling
Strong experience with programming languages like Python or R for advanced data analysis, statistical modelling, and machine learning
Practical experience with data mining, data modelling, and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods and experience with statistical tools (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Knowledge of machine learning techniques such as regression, classification, clustering, and time series forecasting
Demonstrated ability to tackle ambiguous, open-ended problems, using analytics to uncover trends and make informed business recommendations with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong communicator with ability to explain complex analytics concepts to non-technical stakeholders; skilled in presenting insights and recommendations to drive buy-in and alignment with business goals
(Desirable) Hands-on experience in cloud-based data platforms (Azure, AWS) for data processing and model deployment

title:
Business Intelligence Analyst
- job post
description:
Job ID: 180597
Location: Morrisville, NC
Facility/Division: Shared Services
Status: Full Time
Shift: Day Job

Job Description
Description
Become part of an inclusive organization with over 40,000 teammates, whose mission is to improve the health and well-being of the unique communities we serve.
Summary: The Business Intelligence Analyst (BIA) provides insight-driven analyses and insights that enhance decision-making. The BIA is an analytics professional who leads reporting and data visualization development in partnership with stakeholders and analytics teams. Data Governance Stewardship role commitments are expected.
The Business Intelligence Analyst (BIA) has basic proficiency in SQL and data visualization, with the ability to learn on the job. The BIA has experience in stakeholder requirements gathering and presentation skills. The primary responsibilities for the BIA include building dashboards, reporting, and trusted analytics content that is consumed by other analysts or stakeholders
Responsibilities:

Communication and relationships- The BIA acts a key Business Intelligence & Analytics liaison between hospital leadership, physician leadership, other clinical leaders, ISD and other stakeholders. They support departmental and organizational priorities. They serve as a guide of the organization's business intelligence priorities to internal constituents through formal and informal communications. The BIA develops concise, insightful, and politically savvy communications. These are often in PowerPoint, but also in email and verbally via committee meetings, staff meetings, and working sessions.
Dashboard and scorecard development- The BIA develops effective key performance indicators, management dashboards and balanced scorecards that provide enhanced insight and improve organizational decision-making.
Healthcare analytics- The BIA provides healthcare analytics support (e.g., predictive analytics, statistical analysis, data and text mining, data validation, prescriptive analysis) to generate insights that can be transformed into action and include a broad set of tools, processes, technologies, and stakeholders for collecting, integrating, accessing, and analyzing information. There may be fulfillment expectations of reporting and analytics requests.
Project management -The BIA provides effective project management to clearly defines projects, develop project plans, and develops analytics to inform teams and guide prioritization.
Preferred Candidates: will have experience with some of the following:
Healthcare Analytics
SQL or R
Tableau or Power BI Development
Reporting Automation
Project Management
Collaboration with Operational and Executive Leaders
Other Information
Other information:
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in an appropriate discipline.
Licensure/Certification Requirements:
No licensure or certification required.
Professional Experience Requirements:
If Bachelor's degree in general field, requires three (3) years of experience
If Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM field (i.e. Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Analytics, etc.), requires one (1) year of experience
If Master's degree, requires one (1) year of experience
If Associate's degree, requires nine (9) years of experience
If High School degree, requires eleven (11) years of experience
Knowledge/Skills/and Abilities Requirements:
[NOVICE- Limited Proficiency: You have the level of experience gained in a classroom and/or experimental scenarios or as a trainee on-the-job. You are expected to need help when performing this skill.] -SQL and Data Viz software fundamentals (basic proficiency), leading to limited proficiency within 6 months - Limited proficiency of optimizing reusable data sources for visualization and analytics - Stakeholder requirements gathering and presentation skills preferred
-Data Governance Stewardship role commitments expected - Fulfillment expectations of MySupport reporting & analytics single intake requests - Lead stakeholder groups and analytics teams
